title: Capitol Reef National Park: Calendar
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Calendar            Calendar           Keyword       By Date     Start Date      End Date          Search         Upcoming Events    Showing 8 results    Show ALL instances of recurring events   RSS Feed      Capitol Reef National Park Evening Program      Location: Visitor Center Amphitheater Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 05/22/2016 to 10/29/2016 Join us for an evening program at the campground amphitheater. The program will start nightly around sunset and last 45-60 minutes. Topics and start times vary; check at the visitor center or ask the campground hosts for details. View Details      Capitol Reef National Park Fremont Culture Talk      Time: 3:00 PM to 3:30 PM Location: Petroglyph Panel Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 05/22/2016 to 10/29/2016 Learn about past cultures that called this place home. Meet at the petroglyph panel, 1.1 miles (1.7 km) east of the visitor center on Highway 24.   View Details      Capitol Reef National Park Geology Talk      Time: 10:00 AM to 10:30 AM Location: Visitor Center Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 05/22/2016 to 10/29/2016 Discover the geologic story of Capitol Reef.   View Details      Capitol Reef National Park Junior Geologist      Time: 3:30 PM to 4:00 PM Location: Ripple Rock Nature Center Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 05/22/2016 to 09/05/2016 Explore the amazing geology of Capitol Reef in this interactive program View Details      Capitol Reef National Park Nature Talk      Time: 10:00 AM to 10:30 AM,1:00 PM to 1:30 PM Location: Ripple Rock Nature Center Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 05/22/2016 to 09/05/2016 Get in touch with the natural features of Capitol Reef. Topics vary. View Details      Capitol Reef National Park Night Sky Explorer      Time: 2:00 PM to 2:30 PM Location: Ripple Rock Nature Center Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 05/22/2016 to 09/05/2016 Kids - join in this interactive program to learn about astronomy and the night sky (without staying up past your bedtime!).   View Details      Capitol Reef National Park Loa Parade      Location: Loa, Utah Fees: Free     Saturday, August 20, 2016 Capitol Reef National Park will have a special Centennial float in the Loa Parade in Loa, Utah. View Details      Capitol Reef National Park Founder's Day Celebration      Location: Capitol Reef National Park     Thursday, August 25, 2016 Join Capitol Reef National Park in our celebration of the 100th anniversary of the National Park Service by engaging communities through recreation, conservation and historic preservation programs.  View Details
